statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -16 \\ -10 \\ 3 \\ 6 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 47 \\ 17 \\ 3 \\ -12 \\ -7 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 12 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 4 \\ -3 \\ -2 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -16 \\ -10 \\ 3 \\ 6 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 47 \\ 17 \\ 3 \\ -12 \\ -7 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 12 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
